utterance.speaker: Housekeeper
utterance.content: The Waltham Residence.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh...yes..is this..umm..Emily’s Parents’ house.

utterance.speaker: Housekeeper
utterance.content: This is the housekeeper speaking. And by the way, young lady, that is not how one addresses oneself on the telephone. First one identifies oneself and then asks for the person with whom one wishes to speak.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is Phoebe Buffay. I was wondering, please, if-if it’s not too much trouble, please, umm, might I speak to Miss Emily Waltham, please?

utterance.speaker: Housekeeper
utterance.content: Miss Waltham, is at the rehearsal dinner and it’s not polite to make fun of people. Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No no no, I’ll be nice, I swear!!! Could you just give me the number for where they are?

utterance.speaker: Housekeeper
utterance.content: I’m afraid, I’m not at liberty to divulge that information.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, somebody is on their way to ruin wedding okay. And I have to warn somebody, alright. So if you don’t give me that number then I’m going to come over there and kick your snooty ass all the way to New Glocken..shire.

utterance.speaker: Housekeeper
utterance.content: Hangs up.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello, Hello. Ohh, OHH, she knew I could kick her ass.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. Mom. Dad.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Sweetheart. Oh sorry were late, my fault, I insisted on riding the tube.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Judy, the kids..

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Jack, that’s what they call the subway.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Ohh, I thought that you....

utterance.speaker: Ross and Monica
utterance.content: Dad, dad. We got it!! We Got It!!!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ohh, here comes my dad and stepmum. Mister and Misses Geller, this is Steven and Andrea Waltham.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Hello. Hello. How do you do? How do you do? Very nice to meet you. Darling it’s the Gellers. Darling, it’s the Gellers. She’s very self-absorbed, you know. I should never have married her.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: It’s the Gellers!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Well there’s one and there’s another .

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Lovely to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Terribly nice of you to offer to pay for half the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Ohh forget it. Too hell with tradition, we’re happy to do it.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: We know how expensive weddings can be, besides this may be the only wedding we get to throw .

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ha ha, a joke that’s funny in all countries.

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s in it?

utterance.speaker: Waiter
utterance.content: Goat cheese, water chestnuts, and panchetta.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not food...No, I don’t, no... Everything's different here...I want to go home. I...I miss my family. I miss the coffee house. I can’t even remember what Phoebe looks like.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey, it’s been three days, okay.. Your just a little homesick, Okay. Would you just try to relax. Just, just try to enjoy yourself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Your different here too. Your mean in England.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What the hell!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: what’s up, Dad?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: This bill for my half of the wedding. it’s insane.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: How could it be so much? The receptions at their house.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Flowers, liquor, recarpet first floor. New guest bath, landscaping. I’m paying to remodel this guys house. I’m going to give that son on a bitch, a piece of my mind.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad, dad, please. Look I don’t want anything to upset Emily tonight. Alright, she's had a hard enough couple of days as it is. Now here, here, let me go talk to him, okay?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: And you tell him no one takes advantage of the Gellers.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Ooh, Jack.... Sometimes I forget how powerful you can be.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And I’m going to go get drunk.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, ooh,ooh,ooh. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello. Umm, when is your next flight to London?

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: There’s one leaving in thirty minutes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, good.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: And I do have one seat left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, thank you, thank you, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: The last minute fare on this ticket is twenty seven hundred dollars.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, I just don’t think I have enough left on my credit card.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: Well you can split it with another credit card.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, okay, how about five. Ohh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: I’m just going to need to see your passport.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you know what? I don’t have it, but I can tell you exactly where it is on my night stand, and...okay. But you know what? I have my drivers license and I have a twenty.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, face it, my father is not going to pay for the build-in barbecue and believe me you can kiss you gazebo goodbye. Now I might be able to get you the new lawn.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Ahh, then you have to give us the lawn ornaments.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I go back there with lawn ornaments, he’s going to laugh in my face.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I mean we had an agreement. Will you say something, Steven?! Please!!!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Don’t take that tone with me. All-all right you can.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh thank god. Oh, you changed your mind. Oh, look I know you probably want to be alone, and you don’t want to talk about it, that’s fine. I just want you to know, I think you are doing the right thing and...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait!! Where are you going?! What are you doing?! No!! Wait!! God!! Why am I always pregnant when she does that?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’d like to toast, Ross and Emily. Of course, my big toast will be tomorrow at the wedding, so this is kind of my little toast or Melba toast, if you will. Okay. I known Ross for a long time. In fact, I knew him when he was going out with his first girlfriend. And I thought things were going to work out for him..Until the day he over inflated her. Ohh, Dear God..

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Hello, Waltham Interiors.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, hi, Mrs. Waltham. I need to speak with ether one of the best men, or Ross’s sister Monica.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Who is this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I’m Phoebe Buffay. I’m one of Ross’s best friends.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Well, if you’re on e of Ross’s best friends, why aren’t you here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, um, I can’t fly. I’m having my brother’s babies.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Oh, am I on the radio?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No..umm, could I talk to one of them? It’s very very important.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: No, I’m bored with you now. I’m going to cut you off.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh! Okay, I’m going to have to kick her ass too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And I’m sure we’re all very excited that Ross and Emily are getting married at Montgomery Hall. I mean to think, my friend getting married in Monty Hall. Ohh, come on!! Monty Hall!! Lets make a Deal!! Come on, you people!! All right, forget it!! Congratulations, Ross and Emily.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, best man number two, Joey Tribbiani. Now I’m not good with the jokes like Chandler here. Boy...but ahh, I just want to say congratulation to the happy couple. I first met Ross in this coffee house back home...Home...New York City...Where everybody knows my name. Well anyway, I love you guys. But not as much as I love America. Could we please..go home now?

utterance.speaker: Felicity
utterance.content: Are you going home? I was hoping to get to know you better.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m not going anywhere, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I was laughing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Out loud?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well I didn’t want everyone to think I was stupid.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So how are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My mother’s driving me crazy, but Ross is getting married. I’m happy. I’m not going to let anything spoil that.

utterance.speaker: Drunk Man
utterance.content: I just want to say that Ross is a wonderful young man.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, thanks, we like him.

utterance.speaker: Drunk Man
utterance.content: My god!! You must have been a teenage when you had him.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: There’s no way in hell, I’m paying for it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, were down to just one point. Could we please, maybe just settle it after the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: All-right fine, but I just want to say, I’m not paying for your wine cellar. You thieving, would be speaking German if it weren’t for us, cheap little man.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The guy was hammered, okay? There’s no way, you look like Ross’s mother.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Then why would he say it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because he’s crazy. Okay? He came up to me earlier and thanked me for my very moving performance in Titanic.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, my mother’s right. I’m never going to get married.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, you know what? That is....Who wouldn’t want you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, Please?! I’m a single mom, with a thirty year old son!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, I’m back. Listen, I need to...

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello. I need to get on the 11 o'clock flight.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: Oh I’m afraid that plane has already pulled away from the gate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, you know what/ You’re going to have to call that plane and tell them to swing around and come and pick me up.

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: I can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sure, you know what? Come on, we’ll just tell them that there was like a problem with like the "engine".

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: I’m afraid I’m going to have to ask you to step aside, Miss.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look, If I don’t get to London!! He is going to marry that other girl!!!

utterance.speaker: Ticket Agent
utterance.content: I can’t imagine why.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, you know what? I am not leaving here, until you call that plane back!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m getting married today!! Whoo-hoo!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Morning, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m getting married, to..day!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah you are!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ahh, whoo-hoo!!(He runs back out the door.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you think he knew I was here?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well I’ve-I’ve never done that with you before.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, ahh, how are ya? How ya...How ya... You okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yep, yep...You?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes...Yes..Uh-huh, You? We did you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well...I’d better get going.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yea yea, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Could you not look?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t want to look.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhh.

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: Ahh, ahh, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: If you’re planning on doing that throughout the entire flight. Please tell me now. So that I could that a sedative...or perhaps slip you one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. I’m sorry. I’m very sorry. Sorry. It’s just, I’m ahh, I’m kinda excited. I’m, ahh, going to London to ahh, tell this guy that I love him and...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, were the hell have you been?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey. I spent the night out. I met this cute bridesmaid. She is so...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I don’t want to hear about her!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahh Pheebs, you know you’re still my number one girl.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! No, we have an emergency. Okay? Rachel’s coming to London.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh great!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No it’s not great. No, she’s coming to tell Ross that she loves him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But, he loves Emily?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I KNOW THAT!!! You have to stop her!! She’s going to ruin the wedding!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, so, okay...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hold on. Hold on. Rachel coming. Do...Something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so I’m done my part, okay. It’s your responsibility now, okay. The burden is off me, right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So tell me about this girl?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Have you seen Monica?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not seeing Monica.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look we’ve got to find her. Phoebe just called!! Rachel’s coming to tell Ross she loves him!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my god!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! That’s why we got to find Monica!! You know where she is?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!! Okay!! What’s with the third degree?! Why don’t you just shine a light in my eyes?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ...And so then I realized. All this stuff I had been doing. proposing to Joshua, lying to Ross about why I couldn’t come to the wedding. Was all just a way of...

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: Oh, oh oh!! I’m sorry, can I interrupt? You know I just want to say..That you are a horrible, horrible person.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ehh, pardon me?

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: You say you love this man, yet you’re about to ruin the happiest day of his life. I’m afraid I have to agree with you friend Pheebs.. This is a..this is a...terrible, terrible plan.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But he has to know how I feel!

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: But why? He loves this...this Emily person. No good can come of this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well I-I think your wrong.

utterance.speaker: Passenger
utterance.content: Oh-no.And by the way, it seems to be perfectly clear that you were on a break.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh my God! It’s like a fairyland.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: I know, it’s horrible isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, I love it. I only hope my wedding looks this good.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I just hope...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You can let some of them go by!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pisst, Monica. Alright, we really need to start looking out for Rachel. I’ll cover the front door. You watch that big hole at the back of the building and I got Chandler covering Ross.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why would I care where Chandler is? You know uhh...You know sometimes I don’t even like Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I do. I do. I do.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yea, your right. It’s the second one.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Felicity
utterance.content: Hello Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Felicity.

utterance.speaker: Felicity
utterance.content: Umm, I thought about you all day.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Felicity
utterance.content: Um-hum. Talk New York to me again.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Fuggetaboutit. How you doin?

utterance.speaker: Felicity
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: There’s nothing to discuss. We’re not paying for your wine cellar.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: You-you have to meet me in the middle here.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hey, you keep pushing me on this, my foots going to meet the middle of your ass.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dad!!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: What-what’s going on?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nothing, nothing. Everything's under control.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: You want a piece of me, sir? Is that what your saying? You want a piece of me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! That’s it!! Parents!! Parents!! Back away!! All right, this is our wedding day! From now on everyone gets along, and if I hear one more word. NO GRANDCHILDREN! That’s right!!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Waltham
utterance.content: Sorry old boy, sorry. Sorry. Sorry. I could kill you with my thumb, you know.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: What was all that about?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It was...This disagreement over... My god. You...you look beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ohh... Oh! You were not meant to see me before the wedding. It’s bad luck.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know what, I think we’ve had all the bad luck we’re going to have.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: My God. Rachel! Your here. I can’t believe it. What happen? Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well I just came... I just needed to tell you... Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Hello, Waltham Interiors.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Mrs. Waltham. Hi. It’s Phoebe again.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Why?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yea. Can I please, please, please talk to one of the best men? This is going to be the last time I promise.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
utterance.content: Joey there’s a girl on the phone for you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh great!! Hello.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Did you stop Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, but it’s okay. She just came in and gave him a hug, that it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So nothing got ruined?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’s so great! Ohh, so what’s going on now?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, I’m-I’m walking down the aisle...Still walking. I’m about to pass the bridesmaid I hooked up with last night. Hey! I told her "Hey." And now I’m at the front with Ross. It’s Phoebe. He looks pretty mad. Uh...I’d better go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!! wait, wait, wait!! Oh please, hold it up so I can listen.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What we did last night was....

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Stupid.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Totally crazy stupid.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What were we thinking?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m coming over tonight though, right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Definitely.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. May the happiness we share with them today be with them always. Now Emily, repeat after me. I, Emily...

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I, Emily...

utterance.speaker: Minster
utterance.content: Take thee Ross...

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Take thee Ross...

utterance.speaker: Minster
utterance.content: As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, until death parts us.

utterance.speaker: Minster
utterance.content: Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I Ross...

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Take thee, Emily...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Take thee, Rachel... Emily. Emily.

utterance.speaker: Minister
utterance.content: Uhh...Shall I go on?
